descriptionSet.description: In this textile label from Mitra Bussan Kaisa Ltd., we see a woman wearing a red-green Sari, sitting on the floor on a carpet and spinning with a spinning wheel. In the background we see architectorial elements as well as some plants.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

hra:item.hra:value: description-en: In this textile label from Mitra Bussan Kaisa Ltd., we see a woman wearing a red-green Sari, sitting on the floor on a carpet and spinning with a spinning wheel. In the background we see architectorial elements as well as some plants. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: We see an early label of a woman spinning thread, for the Mitra Bussan Kaisa Ltd firm. Background (lattice fence indicating a courtyard and even landscape suggesting trees and water) and foreground lend documentary context for how woman would have worked at this spinning, as well as the tools/accoutrements, required to do her work. The ethnographic approach supports a “sociology of knowledge” that had developed in the imperial toolkit for maintaining control. (Sandria B. Freitag)(gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: the woman spinner is first documented ethnographically, so that consumers can see what a spinner must do in this form of labor: these images of occupation (cum caste in British eyes) quickly become stereotypical. Her working context is carefully if sparsely laid out, showing the tools needed and the circumstances in which she produced. (Sandria B. Freitag)(gs)
related literature: Braudel, Fernand 1981. "The Structures of Everyday Life". London: Collins. (gs)
related literature: de Certeau, Michel 1984. "The Practices of Everyday Life" . Berkeley: University of California Press. (gs)

related literature: Freitag, Sandria B. 2010. "Consumption and identity: Imagining ‘Everyday Life’ Through Popular Visual Culture" http://www.tasveergharindia.net/cmsdesk/essay/96/index.html (22.1.2011)(gs)
related literature: Storey, John 1999. "Cultural Consumption and Everyday Life". New York: Oxford University Press. (gs)
